NutMEG.culture.colony package

Contents

NutMEG.culture.colony package¶

Submodules¶

NutMEG.culture.colony.colony module¶

class NutMEG.culture.colony.colony.colony(name, collection=[])¶

Bases: object

Class for a colony of organisms, which monitors its size and structure.

add_organism(o, n=1)¶

Add an organism or list of organisms to the colony.

If n is passed, it is the number of random instances of org to generate.

base = None¶
collection = array([], dtype=float64)¶
getCHNOPSut()¶

Return the rate of uptake of each CHNOPS element for the whole colony.

When CHNOPSexchanger gets an overhaul, this will need to be adapted.

get_average_maintenance_fraction()¶

Return the average maintenance fraction of energetic input of the alive population.

get_mass(inactive=False)¶

Return the total biomass (dead or alive) of the colony.

get_population(inactive=False)¶

Return the number of organisms in the colony

get_volume(inactive=False)¶

Return the total volume (dead or alive) of the colony.

inactive = array([], dtype=float64)¶
select_timestep(factorup=1.01)¶
take_step(t)¶

Advance the colony by time t.

We calculate the local environment only once to save doing it for every organsim.

buildbaseparams(first=False)¶
params = {}¶
paramtypelst()¶
refreshparams()¶

reset the parameter dictionary to have empty numpy arrays.

Inherit and adjust this method for saved organisms which have specific parameters you want to monitor.
